info.name: Dorsum sellae
info.description: The sella turcica is located in the sphenoid bone where it is home to the pituitary or hypophysis.  The anterior boundary of the sella turcica is completed by two small eminences, one on either side, called the middle clinoid processes.  The posterior boundary of the sella turcica is formed by a square-shaped plate of bone, the dorsum sellae, ending at its superior angles in two tubercles, the posterior clinoid processes.
